Djobel village and rice fields are a bunch of small islands linked by intertidal mangroves (Figs. 1 and 3). According to oral history, the land where the village is located had few permanently emerged portions where some African baobab trees (Adansonia digitata; cabaceira in Creole) existed at the time it was discovered.Fig. 3
